item.title: SSL and Let's Encrypt For Jenkins
item.description: Jenkins (standalone) SSL + Let’s Encrypt In this tutorial, I will show how to use Let’s Encrypt free SSL with a standalone Jenkins in CentOS 7 AWS Install Certbot on AWS EC2 CentOS amazon-linux-extras install epel yum install certbot python2-certbot-apache mod_ssl Generate Certificates Run the command to generate the certificate and key files. sudo certbot certonly --standalone --preferred-challenges http -d example.com Just in case you got this response: Saving debug log to /var/log/letsencrypt/letsencrypt.
